metadata.title: CVE-2021-46943 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:staging/intel-ipu3: Fix set_fmt error handling If there in an error duringa set_fmt, do not overwrite the previous sizes with the invalid config.Without this patch, v4l2-compliance ends up allocating 4GiB of RAM andcausing the following OOPs [ 38.662975] ipu3-imgu 0000:00:05.0: swiotlbbuffer is full (sz: 4096 bytes) [ 38.662980] DMA: Out of SW-IOMMU space for4096 bytes at device 0000:00:05.0 [ 38.663010] general protection fault:0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1003-laptop - 6.5.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required
